translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بی تردید ما به تو خیر فراوان [که برکت در نسل است و از فاطمه ریشه می گیرد] عطا کردیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: ما كوثر را به تو عطا كرديم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: بى‌ترديد ما به تو خير بسيار داديم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: ما تو را [چشمه‌] كوثر داديم،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: ما تو را کوثر (یعنی عطای بسیار چون کثرت فرزند) بخشیدیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: ما به تو خیر و خوبی بی‌نهایت فراوانی را عطاء کرده‌ایم (که نبوّت و دین حق و هدایت، و هر آن چیزی است که سعادت دو جهان را به همراه دارد). [[«الْکَوْثَرَ»: مبالغه در کثرت است، یعنی خیر و خوبی بی‌نهایت فراوان.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: ما به تو کوثر بخشیده‌ایم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: ما به تو کوثر [= خیر و برکت فراوان‌] عطا کردیم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: همانا ارزانی داشتیمت کوثر

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: همانا تو را كوثر- خير بسيار- داديم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: ما همواره به تو تمامی (خیرات) بسیار پربار را بخشودیم‌.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: HAVE SURELY given you pre-eminence (in numbers and following);

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: We have indeed bestowed the Kausar* upon you (O dear prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him). (*Infinite excellent qualities / the greatest number of followers / the sweet pond on the Day of Resurrection)

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Surely We have given thee abundance;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Verily We! We have given thee Kauthar.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Verily, We have granted you (O Muhammad (Peace be upon him)) Al-Kauthar (a river in Paradise);

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: We have given you plenty.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: (O Prophet), We have surely bestowed upon you good in abundance.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Verily, We have granted you Al-Kawthar.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Lo! We have given thee Abundance;

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Indeed We have given you abundance.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Indeed, We have given you (Prophet Muhammad) the abundance (Al Kawthar: river, its pool and springs).

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Indeed, We have granted you, [O Muhammad], al-Kawthar.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (Muhammad), We have granted you abundant virtue.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Surely We have given you Kausar,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Inna aAAtaynaka alkawthara

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: We have given you abundance.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: To thee have We granted the Fount (of Abundance).

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس [به شکرانه آن] برای پروردگارت نماز بخوان و شتر قربانی کن.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: پس براى پروردگارت نماز بخوان و قربانى كن‌

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس براى پروردگارت نمازگزار و قربانى كن

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس براى پروردگارت نماز گزار و قربانى كن.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: پس تو هم برای خدایت به نماز (و طاعت) و قربانی (و مناسک حج) بپرداز.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: حال که چنین است تنها برای پروردگار خود نماز بخوان و قربانی بکن. [[«صَلِّ لِرَبِّکَ»: تنها برای پروردگارت نماز بخوان. مراد نماز خالی از ریا است. «إنْحَرْ»: تنها برای پروردگارت، و تنها به نام او، نه کس و چیز دیگری، قربانی کن.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: پس برای پروردگارت نماز بگزار و قربانی کن‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: پس برای پروردگارت نماز بخوان و قربانی کن!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس نمازگزار برای پروردگار خویش و قربان کن (یا سجود و رکوع کن)

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس براى پروردگارت نماز بگزار و شتر قربانى كن.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس برای پروردگارت نمازگزار و گلو (یت را برایش) فرو نه.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: So serve your Lord with full dedication and sacrifice.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So offer the prayers for your Lord, and perform the sacrifice.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: so pray unto thy Lord and sacrifice.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Wherefore pray thou Unto thy Lord, and sacrifice.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Therefore turn in prayer to your Lord and sacrifice (to Him only).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: So pray to your Lord and sacrifice.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: So offer Prayer and sacrifice to your Lord alone.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Therefore turn in prayer to your Lord and sacrifice.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: So pray unto thy Lord, and sacrifice.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: So pray to your Lord, and sacrifice [the sacrificial camel].

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: So pray to your Lord and sacrifice.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So pray to your Lord and sacrifice [to Him alone].

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: So worship your Lord and make sacrificial offerings.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Therefore pray to your Lord and make a sacrifice.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Fasalli lirabbika wainhar

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Pray to your Lord and sacrifice to Him alone.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Therefore to thy Lord turn in Prayer and Sacrifice.

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: یقیناً دشمن [که به] تو [زخم زبان می زند] خود بدون تبار و نسل [و بریده از همه خیرات و برکات] است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: كه بدخواه تو خود اَبتر است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: البته دشمن تو، همو بى‌نسل است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: دشمنت خود بى‌تبار خواهد بود.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: که محققا دشمن بدگوی تو (عاص بن وائل) مقطوع النسل است (و نسل تو تا قیامت به کثرت و برکت و عزت باقی است).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بدون شکّ، دشمن کینه‌توز تو بی‌خیر و برکت و بی‌نام و نشان خواهد بود. [[«شَانِئ‌َ»: دشمن کینه‌توز. از مصدر (شَنَآن) به معنی‌کینه‌توزی (نگا: مائده / 2 و 8). «الأبْتَرُ»: بی‌نام و نشان. بی‌خیر و برکت.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بی‌گمان دشمن تو بی‌سرانجام [و بلاعقب‌] است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (و بدان) دشمن تو قطعاً بریده‌نسل و بی‌عقب است!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: همانا بدخواه تو است دنباله‌بریده‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: همانا دشمن تو، همو دنبال بريده- بى‌نسل و بى‌دنباله- است.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: همانا دشمنت خود بی‌تبار است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: It is surely your opponents whose line will come to end.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Indeed it is your enemy who is bereft of all goodness.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Surely he that hates thee, he is the one cut off.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Verily it is thy traducer who shall be tail-less.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: For he who makes you angry (O Muhammad (Peace be upon him)), - he will be cut off (from every good thing in this world and in the Hereafter).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: He who hates you is the loser.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Verily your enemy alone has been cut off from the roots.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: For he who hates you, he will be cut off.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Lo! it is thy insulter (and not thou) who is without posterity.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Indeed it is your enemy who is without posterity.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Surely, he who hates you, he is the most severed.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Indeed, your enemy is the one cut off.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Whoever hates you will himself remain childless.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Surely your enemy is the one who shall be without posterity,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Inna shaniaka huwa alabtaru

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: It is the one who hates you who has been cut off.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: For he who hateth thee, he will be cut off (from Future Hope).
